result.execSummary:
The defendant Ray T Kemp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber. Sentence credit of 9 days were
 granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.

No violent contact with Kathy K. Cases 16CM499 &  16CM232 were dismissed and read in. Continue with current After Care program. Comply with any Mental Health/Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
*May terminate probation after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent. 
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

ADDRESS INFO for Ray T Kemp

Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
pretrial incarceration sheet
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ray T Kemp in court with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS HUBER  (CREDIT 9 Days, if revoked)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR     **May terminate after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No violent contact with: Kathy K.
____Continue with current After Care program  
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

COSTS:  $343.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted on Case #16CM232 ($100.00) and remainder due as a condition of probation)
NOTE:  Cash Bail of $500.00 posted on Case #16CM499 is to be returned to poster.  

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department**

CONDITION TIME:  10 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
